intro: Hieracium mollisetiforme, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, often with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium mollisetiforme is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
